Notes: 9% of its electricity comes from wind. Another 9% from biomass.

Majority from bioenergy (energy stored in organic material or sustainable biomass - straw, wood pellets & chips). Nearly two-thirds of the Danish households are supplied with district heating (heat networks).

Kenya is the the largest geothermal producer in Africa (8th largest in world) and has the largest wind farm on the continent. It also boast one of the highest levels of household solar panel ownership in the world.
Onshore & offshore wind power generates 23% of electricity supply
UK is one of the world's leading wind power nations - nearly at quarter of electricity generation comes from turbines.
